channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In Las Vegas, Trump once again pitches no taxes on tips
item.description: President Trump's pitch to stop taxing tips is popular with everyone -- except for economists.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pitch to stop taxing tips is popular with everyone -- except for economists.

(Image credit: Ian Maule/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Exclusive: White House in talks to have Oracle and U.S. investors take over TikTok
item.description: The aim is to place oversight control in the hands of American software company Oracle and other investors. Under federal law, TikTok must split apart from China, or face a nationwide ban.
item.content:encoded:
The aim is to place oversight control in the hands of American software company Oracle and other investors. Under federal law, TikTok must split apart from China, or face a nationwide ban.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Madison Keys wins her first-ever Grand Slam title against two-time defending champion
item.description: Madison Keys was a tennis prodigy, beating Serena Williams when she was just 14 years old, but had not won a grand slam title in her 15 year career.
item.content:encoded:
Madison Keys was a tennis prodigy, beating Serena Williams when she was just 14 years old, but had not won a grand slam title in her 15 year career.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: PEPFAR, the acclaimed anti-HIV program, faces loss of funds as part of U.S. aid pause
item.description: On Friday, a memorandum signed by Marco Rubio called for a 90-day cessation of foreign aid. That would likely put on hold the work of PEPFAR, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, a memorandum signed by Marco Rubio called for a 90-day cessation of foreign aid. That would likely put on hold the work of PEPFAR, the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief.

(Image credit: Yevhenii Zavhorodnii/Global Images Ukraine via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Melody Schreiber

item.title: Trump uses mass firing to remove inspectors general at a series of agencies
item.description: The dismissals began Friday night, according to two people cited by The Associated Press. An email sent by one of the fired inspectors general said "roughly 17" inspectors general had been removed.
item.content:encoded:
The dismissals began Friday night, according to two people cited by The Associated Press. An email sent by one of the fired inspectors general said "roughly 17" inspectors general had been removed.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Senate confirms Kristi Noem as Trump's Secretary of Homeland Security
item.description: Noem will be in charge of executing one of President Trump's biggest priorities in his second term: cracking down on immigration.
item.content:encoded:
Noem will be in charge of executing one of President Trump's biggest priorities in his second term: cracking down on immigration.

(Image credit: Kenny Holston-Pool)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The FDA pulls key DEI initiative for cancer studies from its website
item.description: A Food and Drug Administration project to promote diversity in clinical studies of cancer treatments was removed from the agency's website, as the Trump administration halts DEI initiatives.
item.content:encoded:
A Food and Drug Administration project to promote diversity in clinical studies of cancer treatments was removed from the agency's website, as the Trump administration halts DEI initiatives.

(Image credit: Sarah Silbiger)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Palestinians in Gaza return to find their city in ruins after Israeli troops withdraw
item.description: With a ceasefire agreement pausing the war between Israel and Hamas, Israeli troops have withdrawn from Gaza city centers. For the first time in eight months, NPR got a glimpse of Rafah this week.
item.content:encoded:
With a ceasefire agreement pausing the war between Israel and Hamas, Israeli troops have withdrawn from Gaza city centers. For the first time in eight months, NPR got a glimpse of Rafah this week.

(Image credit: Anas Baba/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Anas Baba

item.title: Once off-limits to Syrians, Assad's former summer residence now attracts tourists
item.description: The summer home of ousted leader Bashar al-Assad was once off-limits to ordinary Syrians. Now people are lining up to visit and wandering around the rooms — which are empty after being looted.
item.content:encoded:
The summer home of ousted leader Bashar al-Assad was once off-limits to ordinary Syrians. Now people are lining up to visit and wandering around the rooms — which are empty after being looted.

(Image credit: Ayman Oghanna for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Reasons to root for (or against) every team in the NFL's semifinal weekend
item.description: Only four teams remain in the hunt for the Super Bowl — the Buffalo Bills, Kansas City Chiefs, Philadelphia Eagles and Washington Commanders — but there are plenty of narratives to go around.
item.content:encoded:
Only four teams remain in the hunt for the Super Bowl — the Buffalo Bills, Kansas City Chiefs, Philadelphia Eagles and Washington Commanders — but there are plenty of narratives to go around.

(Image credit: Richard Heathcote)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan
